Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: nancycary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2011. We were to have been there for 3 nights but they were having a problem with plumbing on our floor. Gerald, on the front desk arranged for us to spend our first night down the street at another hotel. He personally walked us down to the other hotel and got us settled and then came and accomanied us back to Baileys the next morning. We were given a beautiful, spacious room overlooking the street. There was a fruit basket there on our arrival as well as a bottle of wine and bouquet of flowers and a letter of apology for the inconvenience. Gerald could not have made us feel more welcome or more at ease when we arrived tired and anxious about the situation. He was always accomodating and so helpful in suggesting sights we might enjoy and restaurants etc. The hotel itself was in a wonderful area of Rome, all the points of interest were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service - but no daylight in the room”
Reviews.Author: MersuFinland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and were both satisfied and unsatisfied. Pros: good location as many must-sights are by walking distance and the neighbourhood is quiet and nice with several good restaurants. Personal in the reception is very friendly and buffet breakfast is decent, they e.g. served cappucino or other italian coffees to the table. Our room was 'superior' so it was spacious enough for two persons. Hotel is clean and fresh. Cons: there was neither any day light nor a view outside as the only 'window' opened to inside-staircase. The wardrobe is quite little with only a few coat hangers. In the bathroom floor there is a door-stopper beside a sink, it's really easy to hit your toe in it and that heart's!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: CitylassEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 - 6 April 2012. Would highly recommend staying here. Rooms were lovely - fresh linen and towels daily. Fresh fruit in your room on arrival. Mini bar in room and hotel bar were no dearer than drinking in restaurants (if not cheaper than some). The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We didnt use public transport, we were able to walk to all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but the little things spoiled it”
Reviews.Author: Ralph2074
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we were very impressed with the reception staff. The hotel was spotlessly clean, and our bed was pleasantly firm but just about filled the room up. This was the first problem - an incredibly small room, which we know is an Italian thing, but we are rating a hotel and can't allow for the fact that Italian rooms are generally small. Ours was tiny and the only window was blocked by a massive steel fire-escape! There were no in-room facilities apart from the obligatory almost empty mini-bar and a TV that had BBC Worldwide as the only English speaking channel. Not that we drank from the mini-bar or watched TV, but the option to do either would have been nice. No tea or coffee facilities in room, but there was no-where to put it so we kind of understand that. The pillows on the bed were ridiculously large and we found it impossible to sleep with them. The bathroom was so small that the door opened against the toilet bowl - to stop it hitting the bowl a round marble stopper had been stuck to the floor, which we kept stubbing out toes on! Not big enough for two people at the same time unless one of you is in the bath! Stand at the sink at your peril and hope that your partner doesn't open the door and smash into your backside! The shower was ok but the shower head was filthy and sprayed in all directions. The air-con worked but we couldn't turn it off or even down - it kept re-setting to maximum cold. Breakfast was frankly a disgrace. The coffee machine was out of action for every day, so the only option (in Italy, of all places) was overcooked coffee from an urn!!!! The scrambled eggs were so salty that I only tried them once, and the rest of it was pretty inedible. Even the orange juice was almost unrecognizable as such. Not good. We got our morning espresso from a cafe around the corner. Not a bad location, very friendly staff, very quiet, spotlessly clean in general, but not somewhere that we would go back to or particularly recommend unless you are on a budget. We do not view this as 4 star hotel, which is it's apparent rating. A shame, as it could have been so much better if the little things were attended to...

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliBScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in March, location is in a quiet street with a few other hotels shops and restaurants. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, and only to happy to help. Our room was fairly compact, so much so that we found to hard to store our luggage, the room was quite dark in colour and the only window looked out onto a fire escape, the room was also rather hot, and although we did try to turn it down, we were not successful. However that apart the room was and hotel was very clean, the bed was large enough and comfortable. The bathroom again was quite small, but clean and the shower had plenty of pressure and hot water. Breakfast was typical continental, the only hot food being scrambled eggs, but plenty of alternatives. The hotel was a ten minute walk from the station, and we found that we could comfortably walk to any of the many attractions in Rome, the metro can be picked up at Termini railway, or we walked to Barberini Metro (about half a mile) and caught a train to take us to the Vatican on Sunday morning. A tip for seeing the Colliseum, buy your tickets at the forum entrance rather than at the colliseum, as the queues are less and the 12 Euro ticket entitles you to see the Palantine Hill, Forum, and Colliseum. Enjoyed the hotel and would not say to anyone not to try it, but our room was not entirely ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain and Termini station”
Reviews.Author: RLM1981
Reviews.Content: There are lots of things to commend this hotel - the service from reception was enthusiastic and friendly, the train station is easy walking distance, there are a couple of restaurants nearby, the local delicatessens are wonderful, the street is very quiet and the proximity to some major sights in the north of Rome is good. Things that could be improved - our twin room on the top floor was very small with no working air-conditioning, the noise from the other guests on our floor woke me up every morning and the light under the door kept me awake at night, breakfast was limited (but it's a small hotel so I understand that) and the service was non-existent, Christmas carols played during breakfast!!, the area does not have any nightlife and it's a long walk to areas such as the Vatican, Colosseum, Campo de Fiori. Overall, an average hotel but we got a discounted rate so it was probably worth what we paid for it. Would try to find something better if I came back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Maryamac1
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from Rome with 6 friends. WE stayed at Baileys for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. we were fortunate and had a reasonable size room but 2 of the other rooms were very small and didnt have enough room to put luggage on the floor . The bathroom was tiny. The reception staff were excellent and extremely helpful. I thought when i made the booking that the hotel was a bit more central but it was about 30 mins walk to the centre of town. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. After a long day we tended to eat at the restaurants close to the hotel. We found them reasonably priced for a city and service and food was really good. I am a travel agent and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who did not mind the walk into town

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: heloisa m
Reviews.Content: I would like to reinforce the good advise for the Bailey's Hotel and Mr.Thoumy's premium team. The hotel is well located, all cleaned and cosy. The team was always aware whenever we need and late check out allowed since you have booked in advance. The hotel seemed to be full and there are no many rooms. Special thanks to Mr. Thoumy and all his kind assistance to me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome....”
Reviews.Author: curlyyorky
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the Baileys for six nights, we have no complaints at all, the staff were very proffesional and very warming. The hotel was spotless at all times, the rooms spacious and we had a fantastic heating system that warmed us up after cold days sight seeing, there was always lots of hot water and plenty of clean dry towels. The decor of the hotel was very tastefull and made you feel very at home. Ther Hotel is in a good location, and minutes from the station, we would deffinatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: The only good thing i can say about this hotel was the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was lovely and comfy and quite spacious.. Bad Things - No tea and coffee making facilities in the room after a cold day in the snow a warm drink would of been great but this had to be purchased from the bar. A extra 5 euro every time we wanted a drink. Breakfast leaves alot to be desired. Not really into cakes and bread rolls nor scrambled egg which was served cold. No where to dry wet clothes after a day in the snow. Constant hot air blown into room which made it very hot and dry air. No good for asthamatics.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome - I'll stay here”
Reviews.Author: Countycricketnews
Reviews.Content: I travel often and have been using Trip Advisor as a reference guide for many years. Very selfishly I have never made time to leave a review until now. Having returned yesterday from a four night stay at the Bailey’s Hotel I feel compelled to change my ways. It would be improper for me to do otherwise given the great care and thought staff devote to attending to the needs of guests – including some I saw that appeared to be very high maintenance yet were afforded a degree of understanding and patience that they would be lucky to receive in other four-star hotels. I will not repeat in length all the positive views detailed by other reviewers (that I share) but in short the hotel is extremely clean – my girlfriend has exacting standards in this respect so rest assured, the location is great (an easy distance from Termini and a pleasant walk to most sites of interest), and as already stated the staff epitomise good customer care. Thank you for all - I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Mathew B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bailey is a very nice relaxing hotel. The staff go out of their way to make sure you get what you want. Orginaised cars to/from the airport are nice smart Mercs. You get your standard contiental breakfast. Hotel is walking distances to most attractions if not taxis are not expensive and can be organised by the hotel. I fully recommend you stay at Hotel Bailey.

Reviews.Title: “Tastefully appointed rooms, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ann e
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel and it was a great choice. It is in a good location, not far from the train station, close to the American Embassy and just off of some main streets. The included morning breakfast was good, the front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Russell1013
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay for my honeymoon. The front desk staff was extremely helpful helping us find our ways to the various sites in Rome. The hotel was in a pretty good location, I felt safe at all times walking around and there were some nice restaurants around. It was about a 10 minute walk from Termini station, 10 minute walk to Piazza Repubblica, 10 minutes to Galleria Borghese, 15 minutes to Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain, and maybe 25-30 minutes to the Colosseum. Vatican city was pretty far so we had to take the metro, but like I said the Repubblica stop was pretty close. Our room was a nice size and the bed was a huge king size. We really did not have a view at all, just of the staircase, but we figured we didn't want to just hang out in our room while in Rome. We also stayed at 3 star hotels in Florence and Venice and you could really tell the difference between this 4 star and a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meowclops
Reviews.Content: I booked for our honeymoon and was really happy with the room. The hotel placed us in a spacious, comfortable room with nice views to the street - it was really lovely. Unfortunately the bathroom floor hadn't been cleaned all that well so I made sure we left water on the floor the next day and it was then cleaned much better - due to this I have marked it down a point. The staff were great - always a friendly hello and goodbye and would patiently let us practice our Italian (without laughing at us) - there was a bit of trouble in Rome the first day (demonstrations) and the concierge stressed the importance of staying away from certain areas - after watching the news and seeing the violence that erupted, we were very pleased to have had his warnings. The breakfast was good, plenty of choice and some very nice pastries and I didn't mind that it was in the basement at all as it was light and nicely decorated. I really liked the location - we walked to most of the attractions or just jumped on the metro - super easy to navigate as there are only two lines. Overall a very pleasant stay in a lovely room.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denboy69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bailey's Hotel and had a wonderful time. The Hotel itself is clean and charming and the staff could not have been more accommodating. I arrive separately from my group and they keep us abrest of what each other was doing. The rooms were large and the bathrooms were well equiped. My girlfriend had her wallet stolen at the Trevi Foutain and when we returned to the hotel, the staff at the front desk were very helpful in finding phone #s to cancel credit cards ect. I was really quite suprised how much they went out of their way to be helpful. I would definitely choose the Bayley's again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: DavidMatthews
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bailey's for three nights with partner and 11 year old daughter. Staff were fantastic and very helpful. Advantage was a small hotel which was well appointed. Very neat and rooms were not huge but very comfy with great air conditioning to escape the heat. Location was a 15 mins walk from main tourist attractions, but this was a big plus as the area more representative of normal life, albeit in a business area. Short walk to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BeatriceKelowna_BC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, on a quiet street, near some good restaurants, a great wine bar and close (next street) to public transport (buses) which take you to all the main sights. The hotel is welcoming and the service is very good, the front staff are helpful. However, I absolutely agree with another reviewer about a room ending in 3. We were in room 603 (top floor) and it was tiny, with only a small window facing a wall 3 feet away. The linen on the bed had holes in it. The beds (twin) were small. There were no extra pillows. The plumbing in the bathroom needed attention; it was impossible to shower without flooding the entire bathroom floor. The breakfast room is in the basement, so no windows; the choice of breakfast, particularly fruit was very limited. We did not use the bar, it did not look at all welcoming. Our room made us feel that it was not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Such helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Surrey1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Concierge staff were very welcoming, knowledgeable and helpful. Room didn't have a view but it was well equipped, clean and of a very decent size. Location near the metro and within walking distance of the main sights if you're fit.

Reviews.Title: “Baileys hotel -Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: Susila R
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is very clean and neat and they are able to converse in English. The buffest breakfast is good with a steaming hot coffee but the varieties are less. The only exception is that the room size is very small and can accomodate only maximum number of 2 persons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimbo821
Reviews.Content: We were a family of three staying in Rome for 7 nights. Rooms were great - Service was great especially Gerald who was most helpful . All the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast room was cosy the food limited but something to suit all tastes. The staff helped to book all tours and restaurants and taxis complete with maps directions. Cafes , Restaurants and cash machines all round the corner. Hotel very pleasant , friendly , convenient and quiet. The aircon was very efficient and adjustable. Marble reception area small lounge area and great marble bathroom. We have no hesitation in reccommending this hotel as a good base for sightseeing in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, tiny rooms, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bob499476
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms which end with a 3 are the smallest I have ever seen. Having made an agreement with the hotel to not stay in one of these rooms ... they put in one of them. No assistance from the manager or staff, who obviously found it amusing. If you find yourself on the first floor, you will be disturbed between eight and ten pm every night by what sounds like a band rehearsal in the breafast room. You can hear this further up in the hotel. The loacation of the hotel is excellent, all of the rooms are on the small side, but a couple on every floor are very small indeed. The bed-linen is often torn, holed and stained. Rooms are well furnished, but a bit tatty and tired. Certainly the worst breakfast of any of the six hotels at the same sort of price that I have stayed at in Rome. The Interenet in the rooms is shockingly expensive. Much better places to stay in the Veneto area

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in Rome”
Reviews.Author: hippy17
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night post cruise in Baileys hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was adequate size with a hugh double bed , full size bathroom with great shower. Breakfast the following morning was good but breakfast room far too small and no windows . One other negative it was a little out of the way with nothing much to pass on the way to main sights .

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Mezmerized
Reviews.Content: The front desk, especially Giraldo, made our stay welcoming and enjoyable. Always helpful, friendly and hospitable to their American guest who's Italian language skills are quite rough The Twin room was large overlooking the street below... If you don't mind sleeping in a euro twin;). The breakfast was included Mainly filled with sweets, breads/meats/cheeses and a fantastic expresso machine...skip the salty scrambled eggs

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and individual small hotel well placed for transport & neighbourhood restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Scottish-C0uple
Reviews.Content: Bailey's gave us a pleasant and efficient check-in. Lovely room(405) which overlooked street. 405 is one of their deluxe rooms offering more space for which you pay a premium. We thought it was worth it. Our visit was in celebration of our silver anniversary so we didn't risk a free upgrade on arrival as others have written they managed. Room was well looked after by charming housekeeper, who we saw in corridor and elevator regularly but not once in the week did she disturb us in our room. In our view breakfast suffers unwarranted negative reviews. Agreed, it is the same every morning but the options are wide and you can easily vary what you have each morning within the regular buffet. Our only criticism is the breakfast waiter was unduly reserved. This could also be said of the barman in the evenings. Perhaps there is an undercurrent of reserve-not once were we asked if we'd had a good day or what we had seen. But if you make the effort, so do they, so maybe this is just the professional Italian manner - don't impose on guests unless invited to do so? No doubt many guests will prefer it this way. As for location-it's in a quiet, passably select area. Walkable to Via Veneto, Spanish Steps, Termini, Trevi Fountain etc. Bus route on Via XX Settembre, running parrellel to Bailey's Via Flavia, takes you further afield, directly to Vatican, Colesseum, Forum, river walks etc. Incidentally, not a 'sight' as such but we were knocked out by the charm & history of the old Jewish Ghetto. We ate in good restaurants on Via Flavia, within 100m or less of the hotel, including the impressive Taverna Flavia for our silver anniversary meal. Restaurant prices were reasonable enough. Fantastic gelato from the ice cream factory/cafe round the corner from the hotel kept my wife happy on more than one occasion. One feature we wouldn't recommend for those on a 'special' break is the private airport-hotel transfer. We arranged ours through Bailey's front desk at a cost of Eur65 from airport/Eur55 to airport and it was just a standard people carrier similar to many of the taxis. We expected an upmarket Merc saloon or similar. We honestly couldn't differentiate between this service and just ordering a taxi. Having done the trip once we now wouldn't be wary of using public transport. All in all a very pleasant hotel in good condition and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly, Quiet but close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: mario_saleri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short weekend in late March, we read the reviews beforehand but we're still impressed by the hotel. It looks exactly like it does on the picture, the rooms are spacious and well equipped and the bathroom we had was large with a nice bath and marble floors and basins. The room we had a huge king sized bed too! Even though the hotel is lovely, it's best feature is it's staff. Every member of staff we met was very friendly, helpful and charming. They tended to our every need and were exceptionally friendly and hospitable The hotel itself is within walking distance of many of th major sights, a 5 minute walk away is the Republica Metro station at the top of Via Nazionale and the old town, forum, Colosseum etc is about 20-25 minutes walk away. Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain are also within touching distance. The hotel is a lovely quiet retreat, tucked away from the main hustle and bustle so perfect after navigating the crowds during the day. Our biggest tip would be to take a cab from the airport to the hotel, although it it relatively close to the Metro, the €40 set fee for taxis is money well spent (especially given that 2 train tickets are about €30)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent short break hotel, extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lynda1952
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bailey's Hotel for 4 nights. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Gave us maps and instructions to all of the sights, booked restaurants and taxis for us. The location of the hotel is almost perfect. Approx 10 min from the train station and easy to find. Although in a back street, this meant that there was no noise at night. There were several good restaurants in the street which were very reasonable compared to those around the tourist attractions. The rooms were beautifully decorated, very large comfortable beds and linen changed daily. Marble bathrooms with very high power show (did soak floor though). Good selection at breakfast, fruit and juices, cold meats and cheese, scrambled eggs, cakes, pastries and biscuits. Hot drinks although from a machine good selection of choices, hot and plentiful. Would highly recommend this hotel. Excellent value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mmeisen
Reviews.Content: Just returned form Rome last night. Our stay at the Bailey's was just as everyone else has said. It was a delightful small hotel. The service that we received was top-notch. We had a room without a view, but it did not bother us much as we really were only in the room when when needed to sleep. We walked just about all over the city center from the hotel and it was not a hard walk to get just about anywhere you wanted to go. The staff helped us book several tours and also helped us pick places to eat, all within walking distance--1-2 blocks from the hotel. They were not as "touristy" as in other areas near hotels and the food was delicious. There is also a great gelato shop about a block from the hotel. Our flight home was very early so the staff prepared us a box breakfast to eat before we left town and even had 2 cups of cappicino for us at the desk when we check out! How delighful!! The room was nice. Lots of hot water, towels and incidentals. We were next to the slow elevator. Very little sound from anywhere came into our room. The only downside was the bathroom was extremely small. I had opted to use their hair dryer and it was very difficult to get to and use. It turned out that there was a 110 plug on the dryer and I could have used my own hair dryer and flat iron if I had only asked in advance. All in all, I would not hesistate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation, friendly staff and brilliant service.”
Reviews.Author: LJW1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Baileys with our 5 month old baby, and my parents also stayed in the Hotel at the same time. The hotel staff were fantastic, recommending and booking restaurants for us and advising the best time to visit certain attractions. Before arriving I emailed them asking a question about a location in Rome, and they contacted the place for me to gain the answers I was looking for, and responded within 1 hour. The spacious rooms were cleaned daily, and were modern and quiet, and had everything we needed. The hotel is located down a back street, meaning there is no noise of a night, but there are plently of local restaurants within a few minutes walk. The main station in Rome is a 10 minute walk away, and the nearest of the main attractions (probably the Trevi Fountain) is about 10/15 minutes walk away. Breakfast is buffet style and a good selection of pastries/cakes were offered, varying daily, as well as cereals, eggs, and continental breads, meats and cheeses. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again if I return to Rome in the future;.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - staff, room, service excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Suehut
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for us - as a present for a special birthday. On arrival, we were delighted"! The welcome was warm and the guy on reception spoke perfect English and explained all about getting around, the sights and where to eat. The room was very good - the bed was huge and extremely comfortable. The one small disappointment was the window overlooked the fire escape, but in a city centre hotel, one would not really expect a great view. It certainly wouldn't stop me from staying there again. The breakfast was great and was served in pretty surroundings. All in all, thoroughly recommnded.

Reviews.Title: “'Not quite a window on the world, but still up there'”
Reviews.Author: GMO_AJO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome in March 2011 and chose this hotel, mainly based on its location and reputation for service. On both counts, the hotel did not fail to meet our expectations. In terms of location, the hotel is a very short walk from Termini station and very easy to find. Perhaps as importantly, the street on which it is located is quiet (yet just off the main road) and blessed with two excellent and reasonbly priced restaurants. There is also a "locals" supermarket. From the hotel to the Trevi Fountain is a ten minute walk and to the Roman Forum area is about a twenty minute walk. We also walked to the Vatican, though that took about an hour. On our arrival and during our stay, the staff could not have been more helpful. We were made very welcome. We were told where we were in relation to the main sights, how to get around, where to eat ... and about the Roma City tax we would have to pay on departure!! (The travel agents keep this one quiet!) The breakfast was surprisingly good for a continental hotel: srumptious scrambled egg and an an assortment of meats and breads. Even the coffee machine produced excellent coffee. My only gripes here are that there was just one coffee machine serving up to 20 people and, more sinful, on one morning the milk was made from a powder! Our room was very clean and tidy, and nicely decorated. The most dissappointing aspect to the hotel, though had to be the fact that our "window" could not be opened and looked onto an external stairwell. The upshot is that the room benefitted from no natural light. Before dressing for the day, it was impossible to tell if the sun was shining or not! On the plus side again , I have rarely been to a hotel with as much constant running hot water. That was awesome! Shame the bath was a tad small to properly enjoy it, but I think that is the nature of a mid market city hotel so I can not grumble! So all in all, a good, clean friendly hotel in an excellent location. If you can tolerate the absence of natural light, you will enjoy your stay ... like we did,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: geo_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late January and was extremely impressed with this hotel on our first stay in Rome. Brilliant location within walking distance of all the main locations and close to the excellent Metro when your feet begin to fail you. lovely restaurants on the same street for evening food and excellent breakfast in the hotel to set you up for a days sightseeing. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and at no point were we even given the opportunity to tip!! They genuinely appeared as though they just wanted to help. Our room was 405 on the fourth floor and was excellent. Large, tastefully decorated with high ceilings and marble bathroom. Large window looked out on to the charming street. Only downsides were that we booked flight and hotel through easyjet for what we expected was everything fully paid for and included (according to easy jet booking website) but on arrival were told we would have to pay an 'out of season tax' which equated to €3 per person per night (€18 that could only be paid by cash). Easy jet should have told us about this. Secondly I paid for wifi and spent hours trying to get a connection in the room without success (non existent signal) but they did refund this when checking out without me even mentioning it so there may have been a technical problem they were aware of. Overall absolutely excellent and without doubt it will be the hotel we stay in when we inevitably return to the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Service”
Reviews.Author: KathyinAthens
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was offered in a special deal along with our flight, and was well located for the things we wanted to see. My research here at Trip Advisor told me it was well thought of, except for having no windows in the rooms. So . . . when we checked in, my husband politely requested a room with a window and a king-sized bed. The clerk said he would see to it, although technically, that was an upgrade (only 20% of the rooms have windows). Our room was wonderful -- spacious, top floor, big bed. (I suspect that the rest of the rooms are also pretty nice, even without a window.) The location of the hotel is superb. A 10-minute walk from the train station. Only 10 minutes on foot to the Villa Borghese; 15 minutes to Trevi Fountain; 20 minutes to the Coliseum. We walked everywhere! (Admittedly, we skipped the Vatican this time around.) The staff could not have been more helpful, from telephoning for Borghese ticket reservations to recommending places to eat nearby (even before we asked). Breakfast was a plentiful buffet with great bread. We had to depart very early to catch our plane home, long before the breakfast room opened, so the desk clerk made us a cappuccino at the bar and let us snitch a croissant from the freshly-delivered bread box. A delightful gesture to end our sojourn.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: martelsydney
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms, all clean and tidy and well appointed, if not new. Only downside was eggs every morning, too salty! But if that is all I can come up with, a good stay. Easy transport to wherever you needed to go, staff great in giving directions and information. Decent 20 min walk to Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LvTtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded my expectations. Location was very good and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: ReneDeVries
Reviews.Content: The hotels conveniently located, close to Republica. The city is within walking distance, and Galeria Borgesia is only 10 minutes away. For anything further away, the metro is very close. Also a small store is next door, which is ver convenient. As for service, the staff couldn't do a better job. The arrange tickets, taxis, etc. I've been to 5 star hotels that don't offer this type of service, certainly not with the same friendly attitude.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy here!”
Reviews.Author: RPS10
Reviews.Content: Some people are just way too picky. I had read a few negative reviews and got worried about our booking. Turns out, this was a perfect spot for us to spend 5 nights. It's very easy to walk to many attractions in Rome if you enjoy walking, but also very easy to take the Metro or bus from here. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had the "family room" with 2 connected bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, which is very hard to find in Rome. It's on a nice quiet street, which is nice after a long day of fighting crowds. The breakfast was more than adequate--you can't expect to get just what you have at home--that's why you travel, to experience new things!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: CdnTravelFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 4 stars that's more a 3 stars, not that is a bad hotel but it is very average. Yes the location is great, you can walk to most of main attractions in Rome, eat a nearby restaurants and it is right next to a small grocery store if you want to buy couple things. Also there is couple of ATM machine near by and the area is secure. The room is nicely decorated but small and very average on the clean side, not that the maid don't do her job but it would it need some improvements. The hot water in the bathroom isn't the best one and the insonorisation too. On the food side, the breakfast is average and the food salty (no the norm in Italy) with limited seating. I haven't tried the room service. Also you can pay for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good structure; service could be better”
Reviews.Author: bluedog723
Reviews.Content: While room was large and nicely appointed, their service could be much better. I'm very picky about customer service, especially at these prices. So I expected a problem with the Internet to be handled with more than just an "I don't know." Also, we supposedly had a honeymoon package, yet had an adjoining room and when the people next door didn't use their "inside voices," the front desk person looked at me like I was putting him out by asking if they had a non-adjoining room. They have tub showers with swinging glass door that doesn't keep the water from flooding the bathroom (other hotels with the same set up have solutions to this). Their directions on the website for walking from the train station are not as specific as they could be, so call them to be exactly sure where you are going. There are large state buildings that are not mentioned and that should be landmarks that they include because via Flavia is not marked everywhere by a street sign and you easily wonder if you haven't gone far enough or if you've gone too far. When I brought this up, the front desk person again looked at me like I had a hole in my head. All in all, a decent location away from the chaos of tourists but their service leave me a little dissatisfied all-in-all. And I can't understand any hotel property that doesn't ask for your opinions via a comment card!

Reviews.Title: “No windows!”
Reviews.Author: ctinct
Reviews.Content: Great location in central Rome, but beware, my room did not have a window at all, and when I asked, they told me that only three rooms have windows! The rooms without windows have nice furnishings and high ceilings but are dark and dreary.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: BathSquellie
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel. Beautiful interiors and lovely rooms. More importantly the staff that run the hotel are fantastic. Unlike some other hotels we stayed in on our trip we were given an extremely warm welcome. Not only that, we were given lots of information about where we were and also where the main sights were in relation to the hotel and - more importantly - how to get to them! Also without asking we were given a room upgrade. We were also given a free 60 minutes Wi-Fi connection which should have cost 3 euros. Unfortunately we couldn't actually connect to the Wi-Fi in our room, but that didn't matter too much as we could access the internet by using our laptop in the bar. As for the room itself, it was tastefully and sumptiously decorated. We had a lovely big , marble clad bathroom that was equipped with all the things you would expect from a four star hotel e.g. lovely towels, big bathrobes and nice toiletries. The room was also meticulously clean. There was also access to Sky TV and a good range of pay-per-view television if you wanted it. The bed was quite comfy, though the pillows were a little thin. However our experience of Italian hotels is that ALL the pillows are thin! The air conditioning worked well but as with all these things, it was a little noisy. The room also had a small safe in the wardrobe that was locked with a key as opposed to the normal 'credit card' type. Breakfast was really good with a good continental breakfast selection. Plenty to keep you going for a long day's sightseeing. The breakfast room was tastefully decorated, and not cramped with plenty of tables available at any one time. Again, a refreshing change from some of the other hotels we stayed in. This location of this hotel is very good. It's within walking distance of some of the main sites in Rome. More importantly, it's only about a 10 minute walk (with luggage) from the main Train station. It's also only 5 minutes away from local bus stops and on advice we decided to buy a 2 day bus ticket for one of the Hop-on Hop-off sightseeing buses. This was a fantastically easy way to navigate round the city and also see some of the sights we didn't have time to visit whilst we were there. Also close to the hotel are some lovely looking restaurants and a particularly nice cafe. We ate at the Pizzeria at the end of the road and had a delicious salad. Also, directly opposite the hotel is a very nice deli-style shop. Perfect for picking up a selection of cold meats, cheese and bread when restaurant fatigue sets in! The only comment I could make against this hotel was that room service was a little slow, and the menu a bit limited to pizza, pizza and more pizza! However, in the grand scheme of things this was hardly something that would ever prevent me from staying at this hotel again. We had a fantastic two-day stay in this lovely hotel, and would definitely go back again in the future. Of the three hotels we stayed in whilst in Italy, this was definitely the best. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, warm welcome we received upon our arrival”
Reviews.Author: Max60878
Reviews.Content: This cozy hotel is off the beaten path but an ideal location to walk to all the favorite sites in central Rome: Train Station, churches, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and even St. Peters for those with walking experience. It is located on Via Flavia which is one block off a main Street, XX September. There are many restaurants on Via Flavia just a short stroll from the hotel. The hotel staff could not have been more accomodating as they met our every request with a smile and professional results. This was such a drastic difference from the way that we were treated in Sorrento. A free breakfast presented in a cozy dining room really complimented the atmosphere of this hotel. It doesn't have the "bells and whisles" but for the price, it is certainly worth a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kabibi
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was friendly and helpful at all times and everybody spoke very good English. The reception was open 24h. The breakfast was better than I had expected with different kinds of coffee, types of bread, scrambled eggs, juices, fruit, yogurt etc. Room and bathroom were small but clean and more than enough for us who spent most of our time roaming around the city. Very much liked the interior. The room was quiet and the beds comfortable. Cable tv was also nice. The location is great; all important sights are within walking distance (5 minutes to Piazza della Repubblica, 10 minutes to the train station Termini where all the important busses run). The hotel is located in a quiet street but not far off a busy street. I felt save in the neighborhood at night. The only down side was that our room was quite dark. There was only a small window leading to the fire stairs. It didn't bother us much, though, as we didn't spend that much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bailey's - helpful staff at this out-of-the way gem”
Reviews.Author: hill38
Reviews.Content: The Bailey's hotel staff helped make my first trip to Rome memorable. They were upbeat, gracious and incredibly helpful to this American who, I'm sure, mangled their language at every turn. They were able to facilitate a last-minute room change easily, my room was cleaned efficiently every day, the room itself was more than enough room for two people, and the breakfast was yummy (hot & cold foods & endless coffee). The hotel itself is about a 10 min. walk to Barberini. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl180
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights for a nearby conference plus sightseeing. This hotel was a most wonderful find. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful, welcome fruit tray was nice touch. Hotel is boutique size and quality, so only 5 rooms per floor. The rooms are clean and charming with modern bathroom, nicely done but all is the standard small size of european hotels (that was no surprise to me). Breakfast was also good, but again this is in terms of european hotel standards. The location is great, 5 min walk to subway, right near many buses and 10 min walk to main train station. Was conventient walk to many attractions but not on top of any, on quiet street in area that is partly residential but with several other small hotels. Some excellent restaurants in the area as well with more locals than tourists. Overall, it was a great stay and this hotel was a great deal in addition to being pleasant. only downside was shower briefly flashes cold if someone in a nearby room flushes the toilet, and there is no minibar/fridge in the room. This is not the place for you if you want a large busy and amenity-laden hotel in the midst of all the tourist action, or if you cannot give up your American hotel size expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wirlygig
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Baileys Hotel over the August bank holiday weekend. As soon as we arrived and checked in, the man behind the reception desk showed us a map of Rome, pointing out all the major attractions and how long it would take to walk there or where to get the buses/Metro from and to, we kept hold of this map all weekend and found it invaluable, although we opted to walk everywhere as wanted to see as much of the city as possible! Our room was great, a really good size with a lovely marble bathroom and it was lovely and cool. Breakfast was ok, not the best but we hadn't expected much of the italian breakfast from previous reviews, but there was a lot on offer and it set us up for our full on days of walking in the heat!! The staff were all very friendly and helpful, each time we got back from our days of sightseeing, they were interested to hear about where we'd been and suggested other places to visit and also recommended some lovely bars and restaurants to try in the evening. The location is great too, about a 15 minute walk from the main train station (Termini) and easily walkable to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain etc. If you want to use the Metro to get around then the nearest station is about 10 minutes walk away and there are various buses that go from the main street behind the hotel. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location with friendly staff, makes a ideal base”
Reviews.Author: Southernowl
Reviews.Content: A 3 day family break to see the sites of Rome. The hotel had been recommended to us both through this site and others. It didn't disappoint. Tucked slightly away from the main areas, it was quiet and slightly secluded. The staff were very attentive without being over bearing. They recommended some good ice cream stops!! Both our rooms were upgraded to deluxe.Breakfast was plentiful which would set you up for the day ahead. The main attractions were about a 15 minute stroll, though we did use the Metro to get to the Vatican. This was the only area where you were harassed about joining tours. Our flight home was late evening and the hotel were happy to store our luggage and give us use of a room to change which allowed us the time and freedom to enjoy our last day. We used the bus from/to the airport at 8 euros each but the hotel were prepared to arrange for a personal taxi to collect and return us. A nice touch but at 60 euros each way more expensive than the bus. Overall it provided everything we needed for our break and would stay again should we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: janavratil
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with spouse, two young children, and mother-in-law. Had a beautiful room with view of the quiet street. Hotel is clean, comfortable, and staff was very helpful. Hotel was located close to major attractions but far enough from the beaten path. Many small and good restaurants in the area. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel; wonderful staff; enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cbarber333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently within walking distance to the main train station in Rome, as well as to the Hop-on Hop-off bus tour stops. While it is not in the center of all the main tourist attractions, we enjoyed walking the streets of Rome to get where we needed to go. It is on a quiet street, so we were able to sleep quite well, and the rooms were quite comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful - with a good variety of foods to start your day. The staff were SUPER, especially Gerald T.!! He was wonderfully friendly and very helpful whenever we needed assistance. He was ultimately the nicest person we met in Italy (we went to Venice, Rome & Sorrento).

Reviews.Title: “We were delighted with the Bailey's Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTroubador
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe room for 6 nights which was a beautifully decorated spacious room. The external window was double glazed so the room was quiet, and the air conditioning was much appreciated. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Location dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: ClontarfPorky76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baileys Hotel to be with friends who had already booked. Whilst the hotel was OK the location away from the main attractions of Rome was dissappointing. On arrival the Lobby did not appear to be a 4 Star Hotel. Room was large but dark with outlook into light well. Water pressure in shower very poor. Breakfast in basement good and well presented. Best feature of the hotel was friendly staff and I have to say good Restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “1000%!! The Best”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDeeDee
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay in Hotel Bailey's for one night while passing through Rome - we got stuck in Rome due to the volcanic ash and we spent a further 3 nights there. All I can say is we were impressed with how nice and friendly they were when we arrived and we loved the hotel even more by the time it was to leave. The staff were all so helpful, when we found out we needed to stay longer they let us stay at a reduced rate and even upgraded our room. Roberto at the front desk was so nice I cannot thank him enough. Both rooms were very clean, very comfortable beds and had some sky channels (very hand for sky news which we were glued to). Internet wireless was very reasonable and breakfast was a good continental choice. The location was good for us about 10 minutes walk from the train station and in a safe quiet area. This hotel is a definite hidden gem and I would not hesitate to recommend it if you are visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect position. Thanks Tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: AlanGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a busy six days in Rome. 28/02/10 - 05/03/10. We booked The Baileys Hotel due to the reviews on Tripadvisor. What a result. A lovely very personal hotel in a perfect position to all the main tourist attractions. The staff were very friendly and assisted in arranging an evening concert and tickets for the open air bus. I highly recommend taking the tour bus which will take you around all the attractions where you jump on and off as you please. A two day pass is very reasonable. Taxis in Rome are very expensive as is eating out. It is worth while visiting a deli and making a packed lunch each day as lunch out for two will cost around £20 - £30. Evening meals were between £80 - £90 and that was only two courses and wine 9average £22 a bottle). All in all though we had a fantastic time and Rome is a place everyone should visit and The Bailey Hotel just enhances your stay..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel....100% recommend”
Reviews.Author: KHAYES09
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel and I'm very glad we booked to stay here for our trip. We walked from Termini and it was about 10-15 min walk to the hotel which we found to be quite central. We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful man at reception, he gave us some maps and recommended places to go in Rome. We were shown to our room on the 5th floor which was very spacious, mini bar and sky in the room, there was a safe as well which is free. The bathroom was marble and had shampoo/showergel and was very nice, no problems with the shower at all. The breakfast in the morning was good. Good variety of things. Umbrellas at the hotel which you can take with you if you need them. Local little restuarants nearby which were very nice and not far at all, a few minutes from the hotel. Little tip.... you can buy tickets at the metro station which are called BIG, they were €4 for 24 hours of travel on the metro which was very handy and quite cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: genzer
Reviews.Content: I spent two weekend nights in Baileys Hotel. I got it at a very good rate and was overall really happy with it. I'd a very plesent stay and would book this hotel again. Location: A 10 minute walk from the main train station, but in a nice area. Quiet street with some really nice local restaruants nearby. A 15-20 minute a walk from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps and good bus services nearby. Staff: Reception staff were extremely helpful, welcoming and friendly, giving us information on the best bus routes and metro services to get around the city. Room: The room was large and comfortable. Old fashioned style but had some charm. Clean with a nice marble bathroom. Lots of TV channels, mini bar. Shower was a little bit temperamental but fine. Slept really well, quiet room. Breakfast: Was fine. coffee not good. But nice meusli and croissants and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money located near all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Virrvarr
Reviews.Content: This neat 4-star hotel is a really good alternative when visiting Rome for a romantic holiday. Its good location, in walking distance to all major attractions, its good breakfast buffet and its serviceminded staff makes this hotel well worth the money. The rooms are quite small but comfortable with air-condition and comfortable beds. The interiour is quite dated but the room is clean and good. I would really recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel away from the tourists”
Reviews.Author: LittleBritain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night pre cruise. Booked it because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and it'sproximity to our favourite restaurant in Rome –the Trattoria Cadrona at Via Raffaele Cadrona. It is a short stroll from Roma Termini and down a quiet side street, the other end had many restaurants and was quite jumping with locals, not tourists at night. The welcome was friendly, our room was not ready but they stored our luggage whilst we went out to see the sights. On our return our luggage was waiting in our rooms for us. OK the rooms are not big, very high ceilings, but no view at all. We paid a cheap rate so we did not expect the Ritz. The bathroom was fine, nice fluffy white towels and great shower above the bath. We had a wonderful dinner at the aforementioned Trattoria Cadrona at Via Raffaele Cadrona - it is right around the corner - you must have their appetizer selection.....you will not be able to eat anything else. After a very comfortable night's sleep we went for breakfast. I seriously think that the previous reviewer must have gone to a different hotel (!) -there was a large selection - at least 4 different sorts of bread, two sorts of croissant, hams, meats, cake, and several juices, and freshly made cappuccino. It was very good. We checked out- again friendly service and set off for our cruise. In summary a good little hotel, away from the tourists, so better value for money in a quiet part of town. Probably not quite as glamourous as the pictures on the website would suggest but we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Teesside4
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a clean bed then maybe, but four star it is NOT! We read all the reviews of Trip Advisor and the website for this hotel made it look very attractive, but oh my god the room we got was so small and claustrophobic that it totally freaked me out. But that is not the worst, the one thing you kind of take for granted is that the room will have a window, maybe not a great view, but a window nevertheless. Not the room we stayed in, it was your worst nightmare come true. Heavily embossed wallpaper, which matched the bedding, and only maybe a foot either side of the double bed which completely filled the room. The shower was too small to fit in, there were no drawers for anything, and two dresses filled the wardrobe, well cupboard. The breakfast was minimal even by continental standards, but again no windows just a room with a few tables in. Really there has got to be better than this somewhere in Rome, which I have got to say was the loveliest friendliest city ever visited. Don't let Baileys ruin your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended! My 2nd stay there and I love it!”
Reviews.Author: Juliyacos
Reviews.Content: I Love this hotel! It was my second stay there, because they offered the best deal for 4* hotels. I booked the standart rooms via booking.com. But I emailed directly to the hotel to re-confirm my reservation. I got an answer in 20 minutes! I mentioned that I was travelling with my husband and 4 year old son - they immideately sent me a note that they would upgrade us to Deluxe room for free! What a great deal! Super polite staff, very helpfull - even in the middle of the night! Huge room and bathroom - believe me I did my thorough reserach on tons of other hotels in Rome - Bailey's is the only one furnished with KING size beds! (usually it's 2 twins together or 1 queen size). I had even more pleasure finding a fruit basket and welcome letter upon our arrival. VERY SWEET! I loved the location - very quiet residential area, but very close to all sightseengs and public transportation. VERY good restaurants, deli's, cafes around - full of locals! Do not even bother going to eat close to tourists attractions - you will pay double price! I personally experienced it - 4 adults and 1 child ate (including appertizers for each) and house wine (1 litre) - for 54Euro in total, but on via Venetto the smaller dinner with 3 pizzas and 1 appetizer's platte we split was 70Euro! Breakfast was great as well - all you need, very fulfilling! As for some comments about juices - well... Juices in Italy are NOT so great as here in USA - so, do not blame on hotel... We traveled around Italy (Naples, Florence, Venice) and stayed in 4* hotels every where - the same juices - not a problem, the coffe is GREAT! I did not care about bar closing early - there are many local bars around - we had fun with locals... why would you want to be in the hotel bar anyway? So I think they close it early because nobody is using it... I love Italy, I've been there 5 times and will come back next year - definitely will stay at Bailey's.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book The Bailey's”
Reviews.Author: PietroNorfolk_UK
Reviews.Content: I just read the review 'Bait and switch' ,my wife and my experience was in reverse ,Booked the Gambinus Hotel ,switched to The Baileys Hotel. May I state at first that we did not complain openly to the staff. That was not an option on our first visit to this wonderful city an experience which should have included our stay at this hotel. The Gambrinus and the Baileys are owned by the same company. The eloquent fluent Engilsh speaking middle aged male receptionist too fluidly explained upon our arrival at 23.45 that there was a 'water problem' on our floor and they had moved us to a 'more supierior hotel 'and that in his opinion 'the Bailey hotel and our room would be slightly better', they would pay for the taxi and everything would be alright senora and senore. very obliging ,charming ,believable at nearly midnight, so we agreed but didn't really have a choice in the matter as I was not paying at the end of my stay was I ? Last minute .com had payed up ,earned their commission and have since proved that they are not in the slightest bit interested in any of the complaints I raised with them in the form of a return satisfaction email. These were: No assistance with our bags except on leaving one key card only one safe key dark poorly lit room carpet stained and dirty,did they expect us to notice in that light? bathroom showing signs of poor maintenance ie, door stop gone leaving sharp screw like object projecting upwards,(bare feet?!!) chips off bath, poor shower fitting, cramped toilet and bidet arrangement,squeezed in. very noisy hair dryer, very poor sound proofing as I could hear the gentleman above coughing and ...well ..yes.. moving swiftly on The air conditioning was not working .The room was stuffy if on, cold and clammy if off ,there was no happy medium and although I mentioned it and they said they would look at it no person did. Breakfast? an apology for breakfast, I suggest that whoever owns this group of hotels travels to Barcelona ,Prague,Paris Brugge or London as the they will find wholesome fresh breakfasts in hotels that are two and three star. This was an insult to Four star status On Baileys site they state Fresh fruit juice, it was not. It was in fact watered down fruit concentrate cordial . It was dreadful. The rolls I opened were old, certainly not fresh, the worst was the coffee which was granules with boiling water placed in a jug. Remember the British coffee ad with someone making the noise of a coffee percolator? well they didn't even do that ! The whole experience which should have been bordering on Gourmet according to their site was very poor and also extremely cramped. There is no iron and no service provided either . there are no tea/coffee making facilities in our double deluxe room. The ubiquitous mini bar was expensive. I would not trust the freshness of anything. The staff were polite but reluctantly helpful.It appeared that they always were teetering on ending the conversation and turning away to walk back into the office. There were smiles but no happy conversation with their tourist guests. Who do they think is paying their salary. The above unfavourable comments were were mirrored by other guests that we spoke to at breakfast,;there is no lounge area so the only time one meets 'the fellow traveller' is at Breakfast. I will say in their favour that the hotel was clean, the bed was large and comfortable and the linen fresh, the towels were as they state 'fluffy' .....whoopee. Do not go to The Bailey's hotel. We will never book on line with an agency again it leaves you at a distinct disadvantage. When I asked if I could comment about our experience I was told by the smiling receptionist that there was no written system of comment. and no online ability either. So, I am sorry to disagree with others who applaud this place. Our experience was not good. Thank you for reading, oh yes I left my new umbrella in the reception area upon leaving, they must know it was mine but as perhaps expected no one has contacted me to suggest how it will be repatriated.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JPShropshire
Reviews.Content: Having selected Baileys as part of an AirMiles deal we were thoroughly pleased with the quality, near to the station & albeit a little out of the tourist area, peacefully quiet and comfortable room after days sightseeing. Staff extremely helpful, good continetal breakfast, very clean and satisfactory overall. We do not think this is a 4Star , though would use again. Several good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Baileys - great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppet052
Reviews.Content: We booked Baileys after looking at several hotel websites for Rome hotels and read lots of reviews. We booked for 3 nights and we were not disappointed. It was quite easy to walk there from the Termini Station (we googled it to get walking directions). Our room was very spacious (305) on the front of the building looking out over Via Flavia. The bathroom, although not big (but ensuites in Rome tend to be small) was well equipped with lots of towels, bathrobes, slippers, toiletries, mirrors and hairdryer. The room was attractive and spacious and the bedding was clean. The breakfast room was bright and airy and very clean with a good choice of cold buffet nicely laid out. The hotel staff were excellent. They spoke very good English and nothing was too much effort. They gave lots of helpful advice on trips, sights, restaurants etc. It was a perfect location away from the hustle and bustle of central Rome, yet within walking distance to the Spanish Steps (15-20 mins), Via Veneto (5 mins), Trevi Fountain (20 mins) and Termini (10 mins). We booked the Rome Tour (Hop on Hop off bus) before we arrived for a two day ticket and a river trip and this worked really well to get around everywhere as the Metro doesn't go through the centre. We were very pleased and would return to Baileys if we visited Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a sexy hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntigenBand
Reviews.Content: I don't quite recall which website we booked this hotel from, but we paid for 3 nights and got the 4th free... So money-wise it was a great deal, considering their regular prices seemed steep compared to our 80Euro/night max budget. By the way, anytime you're booking a hotel in Italy, make sure to also try calling them directly or check other booking websites, some will give you much better rates than others... Back to the hotel... Only complaint (hence 4 stars instead of 5) - for the first night, they'd stuck us in a tiny little double room, which had no windows to the outside world, and hence felt like a cage (I personally feel the need to always have a window) (maybe this was the "free" night). For the latter 3 nights, they moved us to a much nicer proper double room with big windows opening onto the street. This second room was very nice, no complaints, well-furnished, big bathroom, lots of space. The breakfast was pretty good, not perfect, but they had most things you would expect, plus a few nice simple cakes. The location was a 10-15 min walk from the train station, so I found it quite convenient. Walking into the "heart of the city", which admittedly for Rome is a rather huge heart, takes about 15-20 mins, but you can get to Via Venneto and other nice places within 10 mins, so I didn't have any major complaints about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bailey's”
Reviews.Author: caren078
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location to see the city, catch the metro, and enjoy the beauty of Rome. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The webpage is true to it's content. The room we stayed in ( 204) was spacious and clean, the bathroom was the same. Soap, shampoo, and toiletries were provided daily. Bathrobes and slippers and plush towels were a plus. Breakfast daily was plentiful, breads, meats, cheese, yogurt, fruit, coffee and juice was a great start to the day. The staff was very helpful and there was literature about local attractions available. I would take the steps as much as possible, they are beautiful ( and the elevator is a bit small).

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt return”
Reviews.Author: Glitterbug27
Reviews.Content: We booked a short weekend break in Rome and were given several hotels to choose from by our travel agent (requesting 4 & 5 star hotels only). After reading up many of the TripAdvisor reviews on each hotel, we decided that we would stay at the Baileys. My husband and I usually stay in 5 star hotels, but we both know what to expect from 4stars too...occasionally 4 stars can be equally good if not better then 5 stars! On this occasion - we were WRONG :( Arrived at the Termini train station and decided to walk the '400 meter' distance...turns out the directions arent exactly clear, so we ended up grabbing a map (7euros) from the train station book shop. Arrived at the hotel - seemed like a pleasant enough neighbourhood - so far so good! The lobby is tiny - no problems with that though (just nothing special to look at at all!).Check in was fine, only got one room key (card) and one safe key. Took the lift (snails pace!) and finally got into the room (502) where the porter couldn't be helpful enough. Looked out the window to look straight into a metal stairwell and another wall opposite...bit disappointed but never mind - was more annoyed that we had no natural light in the room. Lights weren't too bright either! A dark terracotta coloured carpet hid all of the stains...just. Bed was fine/comfy - pillows and sheets sparkly white but not so nice stain on the throw. Bathroom was clean, all marble - very compact though...and a door stop attached to the floor right next to the loo (stumped toes constantly! ouch!) Reception were helpful with directions - but recommended the Taverna flavia (i think that was it's name) which was literally 30seconds walk on the same side of the street at the Baileys...it was a dump! Food was cold, lasagne had been re-heated in a microwave, the shared starter was cold & all deep fried too (not at all fresh). The waiters were using phrases like 'the best' for whatever we seemed to order...obviously they thought that standard of food was acceptable! The next Pizzeria along was great though and seemed to be a popular choice for locals (a good sign!). Huge portions, good atmosphere and amazing food! Breakfast downstairs was a small room - no natural light again but oh well. Buffet style and just an assortment of cakes, rolls, 2 hams, 1 cheese, jams and cereal...ok, its more then what you would usually have to hand in your own kitchen - but for a 4 star? I was expecting more! Fruit juices were watered down - almost like diluting juice, Killer cappuccino though!! Bar? - what bar?! - it again was tiny...not a relaxing area to sit in and enjoy a drink. No music/no atmosphere..and no staff/waiter!? Last day we checked out and spent time wondering around before taking a taxi back to the airport (saved the hassle) which cost 50euros. Had time to freshen up in the Baileys toilets downstairs which were huge! - also very clean. Tips - book ahead if you plan to see the Colloseum and the Vatican - we booked the Vatican tour with www.myvaticantour.com.. about 80GBP, but got to skip the que, had a lovely american lady who was very knowledgable. Only que we had to join was the security line - about a 10 minute wait. It was the group tour and lasted about 2.5/3 hours...very good! Rome is beautiful, and we felt very safe walking back to the hotel after nights out. I guess with all major cities you get your pick-pocketers/beggars etc - so just be on your guard. If you like to walk and feel that hotels are just somewhere to throw your luggage whilst you explore, the Baileys maybe for you. If on the other hand - you like to walk and ejoy the comfort (and glamour) or a nice hotel - dont stay here! (P.s- I confess to being a little 'girly'...so i had to trade in heels of flats...a lot of cobbled streets. Oh - and take a hairdryer as the one at this hotel ....well; put it this way; i could blow my hair dry quicker then their hairdryer!! - USELESS!!!)

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robert30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the privilege of staying at this wonderful hotel May 26 - 2 Jun, 2008. What a great week! The hotel is located on Via Flavia, a quite side street parallel to Via XX Settembre (20 September), only minutes from the Termini (main train station). One is close to all the major attractions either by walking, bus, or metro, yet far enough from the constant noise of traffic and tourists. Good hotels are not cheap in Rome and this hotel was no exception. Remember, you pay for what you get. We received a big, big rooom with king bed, TV, A/C, fridge,and a huge bathroom with tub & shower. Even by US standards, this room was big. It was well appointed with a table and chair, desk with drawers, two night stands,and an armoir (closet). A very sturdy safe was also in the room. The bed was very comfortable. I slept soundly each night. The hotel staff was the best I have ever encountered. They were friendly, knowledgeable, and always ready to help at moment's notice. The front desk was open 24 hours a day. Maps were readily available and the staff gave great tips for shopping, which bus or Metro stops to use and available tours and other useful information. Bring your appitite with you as the morning breakfast was wonderful. One must be there to fully appreciate the assortment of items offered. We never left hungry. The hotel lobby was always clean, light, and I never once saw any trash either in the stairwells, or bathrooms. the elevator worked with precision and we never waited more than a minute or two if it was occupied. Being on a side street, it was quiet, very quiet. Blackout curtains made sure you were not bothered by the early morning light, if you were a late sleeper. (Who would want to sleep late in Rome?) If it is your intent to stay at a full-service hotel that is conveniently located, has a very professional staff, and will meet you every need, this is the place. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there are several wonderful restaurants within 1-3 blocks that offer great Italian food and wine. What more could you ask for? The Bailey's Hotel - You really must stay here to appreciate this wonderful property. We are saving our $$ for our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guy12
Reviews.Content: The delux rooms are very good. Some of the standard rooms are small. We had the delux room. Breakfast good, not great. Service very good. Location OK. Overall the hotel rates4 out of 5, although our experience was closer to 5.

Reviews.Title: “Why look anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: NandMC
Reviews.Content: Why should we look anywhere else next time we go to Rome? The room was large, comfortable, elegant, quiet and well appointed. The breakfast was more than adequate and the staff were so obliging and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. We only stayed one night but hey gave us every courtesy and service from booking a restaurant through to storing our luggage until 5pm. It is very conveniently located and offers a high level of provision with personal service. Do phone and book directly rather than use any website because you always pay more that way. Our rate by booking direct was much lower. An excellent comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch - No room for us too!”
Reviews.Author: snippet_sf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because all of the hotels I like in Rome were full. Bailey's was not my first choice because of its bad trip advisor reviews (I like to stay at hotels that have at least 90% positive reviews and a solid 5 rating). Still, I couldn't find another hotel without negative comments for the dates I needed. Bailey's looked like the best of the "not-so-good" choices. I'd heard about hotels in Rome that overbook on purpose and then send you to another hotel. I'd even read about it in one of the Bailey's comments, so you can imagine what I was thinking when they did it to me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I quote: "I'm sorry, but the people who were supposed to check out of your room had their papers and money stolen, so they can't leave. We are fully booked, but will be happy to send you to another hotel nearby." HA!!!!! This is exactly what happened to the “No room for us...” Tripadvisor reviewer! We didn't quibble with the woman at the front desk about the move (I already know we'd been played). We just dragged our bags down the street to the other hotel (Hotel Gambrinus Roma). There was a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room when we got there and an apology note from the Bailey's manager. Still, it was a bit disconcerting. To me a reservation is a contract. and when that contract is breached, it calls the credibility of the hotel into question. It made my traveling partner and I a little uncomfortable--we joked about waking up in the morning in a tubful of ice and one of our kidneys missing. Bailey's obviously does the bait and switch a lot because when my traveling partner was passing through the lobby later that same day another set of guests were checking in who had also received the "people in your room got robbed" story (they were talking about it to one another and she overheard them as she left the Gambrinus' lobby). In closing, Hotel Gambrinus Roma was fine. The room was a little worn, but lavishly decorated (some people might call it gawdy). It had a sitting room adjacent to the bedroom--which might have been an upgrade from the standard room we booked. Who knows. So, go ahead and reserve a room at the Bailey's... Just don't be too surprised if you don't end up staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Bailey's and I would sum it up as per the title. The hotel is in a quiet location and this suited us just fine. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and 5 - 7 minutes from the nearest Metro station. We arrived early and were met with a very friendly receptionist and were allowed into our room straight away. The room was nice but the view was non-existent (a lift shaft and you could just see the sky if you craned your neck up). Very comfy bed and the bowl of fruit as mentioned in other reviews. Bathroom was smelly and we had a chipped bath (seems common from other reviews) but after mentioning the smell at reception it was sorted and fine for the rest of the stay. Plenty of hot water. Breakfast was OK (echo the comments about the watered down fruit juice - I watched the waiter pour a two litre bottle of spring water into it) but nothing to be excited about. There is a bar but it's opening hours are a bit luck of the draw. We got back one evening about 23:00 and couldn't get a drink. Resorted to the mini bar instead (not too expensive) but not the same as sitting in the bar for a nightcap. Some good resaurants nearby (Taverna Flavia was excellent) but I'd recommend heading to the area around Piazza Navona, Trevi Foutain, Spanish Steps or Piazza del Popolo where there is much more going on. Also recommend the open top bus tour - but make sure you make a reservation - we didn't and missed out a bit. Overall an OK hotel but if going back to Rome, I'd probably opt to stay somewhere else for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull stay”
Reviews.Author: Roma58
Reviews.Content: We stay the first time at the end of december, and it was perfect, the new front office manager gerald, important experience in five star he knows exactly what the guest need. He suggest us good adress he takes care of us ans his staff are perfect ( fabio and Agnese ), one of the reception is not really nice his name is Genaro. We back again for more than one week, and it was perfect like the first stay, we will have other possibility to go back in Rome and now we know the hotel..... Thank you Gerald and your staff The room was clean but It will be better to change the bathtub as soon as possible. Spain

Reviews.Title: “No room for us...”
Reviews.Author: I_Need_A_Break_NOW
Reviews.Content: We had booked a deluxe room here for one night, but when we arrived, the hotel gave an excuse that somebody in the room had been robbed and that the guests in our room could not move out. They had no other free rooms available. They did not want to enter into any kind of discussion and clearly were overbooked and gave an excuse why they couldn't help us. They had arranged an alternative hotel down the road, which was OK. But it was quite evident that there is some deal going on between them as the hotel we were moved to seemed used to this and they were around 70% booked for the night and probably needed guests. I want to post this as a warning as their handling of it was not professional and even though you book this hotel, you're not sure to actually get a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - nicely placed”
Reviews.Author: spiritualight
