Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel was slightly confusing for the taxi driver as he was unsure of the location, however upon arrival we were greeted by friendly Reception staff. Although we arrived earlier then we could check in we were allowed access to our rooms - the room was lovely - beautifully decorated with enough space to break open our cases and unpack all our things. Well air conditioned with a nice mini bar, a thoughtful bowl of fruit too and very large kingsize bed. As I was sharing with a fellow girlfriend there was no chance of impeding into the others space. Bathroom was marble and very clean, had a shower and bath with a bidet too. Very large mirror in bathroom so getting ready for a night out was easy. Breakfast was ok fruit juices felt watered down but apparantly thats how they are served in Italy. All cold breakfast items and cake was strange to eat at that time of day but it was very tasty. Location of hotel was near to some very good restaurants so we were spoiled!! We were about a 20 minute walk from Termini main line station and nearest metro line was Republica which was 10 minutes walk. Trevi Fountain was a good 15-20 minute walk but the walk was enjoyable. Would recommend the Trour buses to see Rome and probably the 110 is the most frequent tour bus service. Other tour operators have 45 minute gap between busses - most go and can get picjed up from Termini, however 110 can be accessed at Republicia. I would most definately return to Baileys when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherbert
Reviews.Content: Fabulous little hotel, Yes it is a walk from the centre, yes the bar area is very small, yes the lift can be a little slow, HOWEVER! Myself and partner wanted to spend time together and loved this little place. We were in Italy for a wedding and stayed here for 4 nights, it was fantastic. A true gem I would recommend to anyone (and have done on several occasions). Lovely bedroom and exceptional breakfast (Italy doesn't traditionally have such a choice). We ate in the same restaurant each evening which was recommended by the hotel, lots of famous people's pictures on the walls, however wouldn't remember the name but a lovely meal each evening with fab Prosecco - again when in Rome! (rather than Champagne!) Try it you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo89
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, with an excellent structure. Rooms with Internet service and cable TV. It's not far from historical centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel overall - value for money”
Reviews.Author: froggy26
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Baileys with my husband for 4 days in May. I'll try and list some of the pros and cons here... Pros Clean and quiet hotel Pleasant buffet breakfast area - fruit juice, cereal, pastries or bread rolls and cheese probably your best bet - there are also biscuits and cake! service fast, tea coffee or capuccino served. Staff are fairly helpful and friendly and will call a taxi or point you in the direction of a local restaurant. They all speak english if like us your Italian is not good and provide a map on arrival circling the main attractions which was appreciated! Air conditioning in rooms. Robes provided . Some snacks provided in a drawer (although they were melted when we arrived as the air conditioning was not on) Cons A standard room is very tiny - I guess this must be usual in Rome and you get what you pay for but would advise getting a bigger one as it felt very claustrophobic, there was a view from the small window of the back stairs and a door leading outside was often left open blocking the window. If you are pregnant or overweight you will find it difficult to get into the shower in the standard room as doors are partially blocked by the sink. Very small, slow lift Mini fridge did not keep drinks cool and bar downstairs closed early Safe also very small Shower only in the bathroom but bath foam provided rather than shower gel which I found odd! Location not spectacular - it is fairly close to the Termini station and I would advise going there to get on the 110 red tourist hop on hop off bus to get your bearings. I would not look for the tourist buses advertised in the leaflets at reception as they were impossible to find for us, and you will not find as many in the city as regularly. You would also be within walking distance of via veneto which has some nice but pricy restaurants and the spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulahorsfall
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the recent bank holiday weekend in Rome and stayed at Bailey's Hotel. We found the staff to be charming and courteous and our room was comfortable - we had a king size bed instead of twins but we still didn't notice each other during the night! Very pretty breakfast room with delicious chocolate cake for breakfast! The location was a bit further from down town Rome than anticipated - the receptionist said a ten minute walk to the Spanish Steps but mor like twenty minutes brisk walking or half an hour stroll. Cost between 5 and 9 Euros in a taxi. Would stay here again. If you want a hotel with a bar - don't chose this one though as the bar is almost an afterthought - no atmosphere and not a place to linger.

Reviews.Title: “Good physical accommodations (for Rome)”
Reviews.Author: denverryans
Reviews.Content: If you are not familiar with Italian "customer service" please read up on the different standards for hotel staff for US vs Italy. We have traveled to many European countries over the past 20 years so we are not newbies. For the Hotel Baileys do not expect anything more on the service side other than a chilly reception (for Americans?). We are not ethno-centric typical American tourists but it seems like everyone hates us right now due to our political stance in the world, and the staff at the Hotel Baileys are no different. We had hoped for more for our 1st wedding anniversary but the staff were straining to be minimally friendly. They were not busy during our stay in Sep-Oct 06 yet did not do anything for our prearranged anniversary date not even a flower in our room, much less a bottle of wine or Prosecco. The room was good for Rome standards at this price - very clean but small. Breakfast room, food and service staff were the bright point of our visit Location is not as close to the train station as the hotel website suggests, and make sure you are comfortable exploring on your own before trying to get there without a very very precise map after normal business hours. Having said that, we love walking around (even with luggage) and this is a decent neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! at Hotel Bailey's”
Reviews.Author: LaserDean
Reviews.Content: Since there is no one perfect place in Rome central to all the sites, Baileys is an undiscovered jewel when it comes to comfort and service. The hotel is located on a quiet street and is close enough to the subway so that even us out-of-shape Americans can connect with the transportation system without too much trouble. There are excellent restaurants nearby that were recommended by the staff. Speaking of the staff, they are the absolute best I've seen in the small hotel genre. Every detail was impeccable and they were most helpful in helping us get around the city and arranged our transportation to and from the airport/seaport both ways without a hitch. A great value when compared to other 3-star hotels. The breakfast was wonderful and the room we stayed in, which was a "deluxe" room was large and comfortable. Would I stay there again? You bet your life I will, the next time I'm in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Rooms at Bailey's”
Reviews.Author: FABFIFTY
Reviews.Content: Bailey's Hotel ticked allmost all the boxes for my husband and I. The room was very quiet, clean and cool and the staff came twice a day to replentish toiletries. On the minus side it was very dark and due to being a side room overlooking an internal courtyard we never saw daylight! A ggod touch was the automatic light that lit up when you went to the bathroom, you neded it as the room was pitch black at night! The other lack was no tea and coffee making facitlites, which I would have expected for a four star hotel. The breakfast was good though, with plenty of choice Some of the staff were friendly and helpful but a couple were quite 'standoffish', however, on the whole this did not detract from our stay. The location was excellent, turn left ouside the hotel, then tun right at the junction to go straight down Via Septembre, you carry on and reach Barbarini where you can get the hop on off bus, or walk to Trevi or Spanish steps. One day we carried on walking down hill, to go past the forum to the Colleseam, wonderfull!.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bailey's”
Reviews.Author: Viking26
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at this hotel. The staff was great, more than helpful when a piece of luggage was lost and dinner recommendations in the neighborhood were excellent. Easy walk to Metro, one stop from Termini. Would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Service”
Reviews.Author: zackhb
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good. All the service staff that we came into contact with from checkin to checkout were very professional and helpful. We arrived before the checkin time and the we left our luggages with the Porter and the staff at the Front Desk recommended us a nice pizza place near the hotel. He also also helped us to book for Borghese Gallery tickets and recommend good shopping places. They were both were very helpful and courteous. The bedroom and bathroom size were very good and clean. Very comfortable & quiet room. The walked to all touristic attractions as the hotel is central to all historic sights (except the Vatican is only 15 minutes by taxi). There are several nice restaurant and cafe around till late evening too. I definately will recommend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: Oldcolonial
Reviews.Content: Ever thought of going to Rome? stop thinking and just go, it is aa awe-inspiring experience and we absolutely loved it. We stayed at the Bailey`s Hotel for 6 nights and had a deluxe double room, these rooms are of a good size and have an ensuite marble bathroom with a good selection of toiletries, huge bath towels and even towelling bathrobes. The housekeeping staff do an excellent job and the room and bathroom are extremely clean and in good decorative order as is the rest of the hotel. The hotel is located in a quite side street and we were never disturbed by any noise, the hotel is pretty well soundproofed. The breakfast room is very clean and there is the usual selection of juices, pastries, cheeses, cold meats, tea & coffee etc, they will provide hot items but there is an extra charge. The staff at the hotel are all very friendly and helpful, the team on the reception recommended some excellent nearby restaurants and these include: La Pentolacchia, very stylish, excellent food and service, meal for two including botlle of wine approx £60.00 La Vincenzo, top quality fish speciality restaurant, this was also very good and a meal for two including wine approx £50,00 il Pomodorino, this restuarant is huge and the range of food equally vast, good food and good service, meal for two with wine approx £50,00 The quality and value of these restaurants is far better than the U.K equivalent and you will not be disappointed with any of them. The Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and other tourist attractions are within a 15 minute walk of the hotel, the Colliseum 30 minutes and the Vatican about 45 mins. You can buy a ticket for the open top tour bus which is valid for 24 hours and can hop on and off the bus as often as you wish and this is quite a good way to get around, the metro is also very cheap and you can travel on this for as little as 1 euro. When you visit the Vatican the queue to the entrance can stretch for several hundred yards, when you are in this queue you will be approached by people offering you a tour guide service, as the entrance for guided tours is sperate and virtually free of any queue this is a very temping offer, do not go with these people, they do not have access to the fast track official tour guide entrance and after paying 37 euro each at their office across the road you will end up in the same queue you were already in and be no better off. We did a great deal of walking around the city even late at night and felt very safe as there is such a visible police presence everywhere and there also seems to be a police station on just about every block. The only problem you may have is with the gypsies that will approach you holding up a piece of cardboard and try to push this up towards your face, this is an attempt to block your view while they pick your pocket, DO NOT let them even get close to you, push them away with as much force as needed. There are also hawkers that will walk up and try and place items in your hands, just tell them firmly no and they will move on We booked our transport from the airport to the hotel with a company called "Jimmytour" and they were excellent, the driver was smartly suited and waiting for us in the arrivals hall, the car was a beautiful E class Mercedes and he gave us a good deal of useful info en-route and he was also a very good driver, we booked him for our return jouney and will also use them again when we return to Rome.. Loved this trip and could not fault the hotel or the excellent staff and yes I plan to return in October.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaFBelfast
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Rome which was made complete by staying in Bailey's Hotel. The room was comfortable and spacious, the staff were extremely friendly and couldn't do enough to help. It was situated in a quiet area about 15minutes walk from the Spanish Steps but was surrounded by great bars and restaurants. It was a super base to explore the wonders of Rome and we would definately stay there again on future visits

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful base for a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Galwayboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the wonderful Baileys from 15th to 19th March 2006 and absolutely loved the place. Staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good english. The room (404) faced the street below and has a lovely marble bathroom combined with high ceilings and a great sense of space. Breakfast was excellent and the room service pizza's were a treat. As other posters have indicated, there are excellent places to eat within 100 yards and I am hard pressed to find any fault with the hotel........well, bar could have more comfy furniture but that will not stop me booking again. A wonderful place to spend St Patrick's day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KazBristol
Reviews.Content: Having just spent three days in Rome on the go all the time, it was great to come back to the Baileys Hotel at the end of the day. It's in a quiet street away from all the noise but not too far to walk to many of the 'must see' sights. Its handy for the Metro and buses too. The staff were friendly and spoke good English. The room was clean, tidy and quite spacious(we were in a standard double). There was plenty of choice at breakfast and great coffee! The area had plenty of places to eat at reasonable prices and the hotel staff are happy to recommend local restaurants and pizzerias. The Baileys made a great base from which to explore this amazing city. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bailey's is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Beckett
Reviews.Content: After a 15 minute walk from Termini station we arrived at Bailey's to a warm welcome. The reception staff are very frendly and professional - they provide information about restaurants and city tours as well as a good street map. We stayed in room 205 which is very spacious and well furnished (although the bathroom was rather compact). Our room was cleaned daily and fresh bed linen supplied. Breakfast is served in the basment area with a good selection of juice, fresh fruit, bread, cereals, cold cuts cheese and scrambled or boiled eggs. Optional extras were also available for a small extra charge. The hotel is located in a quiet residential/business area of the city with a few local restaurants within a short walk. Our favourite was Giovanni's, a family owned restaurant with the most delicious minestone soup. We would recommend this hotel for its quiet location and superior accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Coyoacan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bailey's for 5 nights in mid January; taking advantage of a quiet Rome and a special 4 nights for 3 offer. Overall I rate the hotel (for tourism) as 'good'. Plus features include: - No problem with early check-in - A nicely decorated room (facing the street - 505) - An excellent size and comfortable bed (super King size) - Prompt and efficient service - An excellent shower - Complimentary breakfast - A quietish neighboorhood - away from the main tourist sites - A short walk to the local bus stop for trips (10 mins) into town Points for improvement would include: - Make the lobby / reception area more attractive - at present there is minimal decoration / no flowers / plants etc.. - Keep the lights on in the bar - I didn't see a single drink being served all week. Did they want to create an 'atmosphere' in the hotel? Overall, a good choice. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a stately area”
Reviews.Author: Onholsalot
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a short break in Rome, where we stayed in the Hotel Bailey on a recommendation from a friend. We had a good-sized room (604) which was very clean and comfortable, with an adequate marble bathroom. The hotel is a little bit away from the main tourist sites, but we had no problem with that, and there are a number of restaurants and cafes nearby that are not remotely touristy, which is nice in such a busy, touristy city. We were very happy with the hotel and its environs. It is a pleasant walk to the Spanish Steps, and from there to the various other attractions. If your feet become tired, as they inevitably will in a city like Rome with all its marble floors, taxis are very good value. We took a taxi from Trastevere back to the hotel on Sunday afternoon (not much traffic, but higher rates apply) and it was only about €8. Rome is a city to walk around, but after a hard day's sightseeing, taking a taxi back to the hotel is a sensible option. If you don't want to make your way back into the tourist centre of the city, the nearby Ristorante la Lampada serves good home-made pasta. When you go to a city primarily for the sightseeing, the grandeur of your hotel is immaterial. The Bailey is very comfortable (though I thought the breakfast coffee was fairly bad), and the perfect spot to come back to in the evenings. On the subject of sightseeing, the suburb of EUR (take the metro to EUR Termi) has wonderful examples of 'fascist classical' architecture to provide a cultural counterpoint to the mainly renaissance charms of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, location not great.”
Reviews.Author: PinkyT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bailey from Dec 30-Jan 4, 2007. It is a beautiful hotel...charming, well decorated. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, the location is somewhat removed from all the piazzas you'll want to be near at night (for dinners, bars, people-watching.) Also, the metro in Rome is quite minimal, and Hotel Bailey is a walk from the nearest metro, in a somewhat sketchy area at night. Additionally, with all the walking and sight-seeing you'll do during the day in Rome, the 20 minute walk to a good area isn't that appealing. The breakfast was also pretty bad. The pastries and fruit seemed very old and stale. But it's free, so whatever. All in all, I would not choose this hotel again based purely on location. If you're a big taxi person anyway, then this a beautiful old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overated”
Reviews.Author: JCMMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Overated.... We booked because it had great reviews and accetable price but we were dissapointed. -We were offered a room with a view to a terrace, our view was to the fire stairway. -TV no good. -We were on the 6th floor the elevator was very slow and only to persons could fit. -Gret Breakfast. (it was included in our tate 150 € per night) I think it was a little bit far from rome center and the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoyntonClan
Reviews.Content: We decided on Rome for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and so looked for a good comfortable hotel. We were attracted by the reviews Baileys had on TripAdvisor. We booked the Hotel on the hotels website and found it clear and easy. We arrived in Rome on the Leonardo train from Fiumicino Airport to the Termini station. This Station is very large and we suggest you stay inside the station and walk past the other platforms leaving the station by the main entrance where the ticket offices and shops are, this can take upto 10 minutes! Fom this point the hotel is 10 to 15 minutes walk. The hotel is on a road parallel to the 'Via XX Settembre". Via Flavia is quiet with a mixture of Hotels Restaurants and small businesses. Baileys is a small hotel but is well appointed and nicely decorated, our room was larger than we had been led to expect for Rome. The service provided in all aspects of the hotel was exemplary. Whilst one expects the hotel to act on any problems you may point out, I was surprised when I noticed one of the light bulbs in our room was out as we left for a walk to the coliseum one morning, on our return the bulb had been replaced without us mentioning it at all! It shows the sort of care taken by all the staff. The breakfast buffet was nicely presented with a sufficient choice to accommodate our tastes. We found the hotel to be convenient for the major sites and although in Rome you should expect to have to walk we found the routes enjoyable and not too strenuous. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo!”
Reviews.Author: Us_Deux
Reviews.Content: Entering my 40 th, my wife Lina surprised me and took me to Rome. What a better place to stay than the Bailey's Hotel. It wasn't in the middle of the noise and clutter but no more than 15-20 minutes away from the sights. Once you get your bearings within a day or so you'd see and understand how close you are to these places. If you need help definitely ask Simona at the front desk. Simona will send you on your way which will be just right. Go on a tour to Florence. Highly recommended. The hotel atmosphere wasn't grand but just right. Room was comfortable enough for two ( not that you'd want to stay inside with all to see) and the bathroom was always clean. The breakfast was astonishing. Great service! and Excellent coffee (American). Must wake up early enough to taste the fresh eggs! At night if you're hungry from walking and shopping all day,across the street from Bailey's hotel exiting left a block away, try theGreek food from Mythos, or the assorted food from the snack shop in front of the Newsstand. Make sure you don't buy from the snack shops near the tourist areas, they tend to overcharge, ie. 3,95 for 1 warm Coke or ask how much before you sit down. Over all Bailey's hotel was exactly what we needed not too much and not to little. With excellent service and no complaints! Any questions, always ask Simona she'd know what to do for you, and she always does it with a smile! Bravo to Baley's and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bakeapple
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed @ Bailey's for 5 night's. We found it quite adequate. It was close to termini and in walking distance of lot of the tourisity places. The staff were helpful and the room was more then we expected. We really enjoyed our breakfast each day. Gave us agreat start to our day. Staff were nice but especially Simona !!!!!!!! Would recommend this place to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cestlaviv
Reviews.Content: I really don't get it! I chose this hotel, mainly because of the reviews in this page. I found the location bad, yes quiet, that it is, but def. not a "cool" or "cute" or anything location. The staff was terrible, the lobby and the rest of the hotel def. missing personality. Way too expensive for what we got. The room was a nice size, ammenitites terrible, comfy bed, worst view ever.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family style hotel 28-29th Oct 2006”
Reviews.Author: Roots-and-wings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baileys with a number of friends for a 50th Birthday. The Hotel was well placed and was very clean and tidy. It had obviously been renovated in the last few years. The room was very well decorated and the bed very comfortable. The size of room and en-suite were what you would expect of a major European City, not over generous but nothing to complain about. Some very nice touches with fresh fruit in the room. I found the breakfast fine, not a big English but hey this is Rome. There was certainly a selection and plently of it. The staff were pleasant and helpful tho you did have to seach out someone to serve you at the tiny and not well appointed bar. Just a very nice family feel city hotel that I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, but watch the bill”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-on-Tyne
Reviews.Content: Situated away from the bustle of the main tourist traps in Rome , Bailey's Hotel is still easily accessible to most of them by metro, bus and good old fashioned walking. My wife and I selected it primarily for its proximity to the Termini station as we were arriving by the bus from Ciampino airport which stops outside the station and eventually departing by train for our onward trip to Naples. We spent four nights there in early November. The hotel staff were very welcoming and were only too pleased to provide us with advice on places to see and make recommendations for restaurants etc. The room was clean but rather garishly decorated. It had very atmospheric subdued lighting which was fine except that it made identifying the contents of one's suitcase at night a bit difficult ! Breakfast was served in a rather small but adequate room. A good range of the usual cold buffet items was provided. A nice touch which pleased us as English tea drinkers was the provision of a reasonable sized teapot to allow the beverage to infuse - unlike the sad "teabag in the cup scenario "which is found frequently in many continental hotels. Unfortunately the hotel's accounting system is not too efficient . Upon our departure we were billed for extras ( a hot breakfast and items from the minibar) which we had not consumed. After some discussion ( a good job we were not in too much of a hurry to catch our train) these were cancelled. However the incident left a bit of a sour taste which spoilt what otherwise was a very pleasant stay there. Nevertheless it is still a fine hotel and we would definitely stay there again when in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CCJE
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 4 nights at Baileys. The accommodation was of a very high standard and immaculate. The staff were very helpful and informative and arranged a taxi back to the airport at a cheaper rate than public transport for the 4 of us. The hotel was situated in a quiet road but easily accessible for public transport. After a busy day of sightseeing we did not want to travel far for restaurants and found plenty of very good restaurants in this quiet street.. We would particularly recommend the Taverna Flavia -the food was excellent and the atmosphere was very relaxing. Breakfast at the hotel was of a very high standard- lots of choice. Everything was freshly prepared and the coffee was excellent. We would certainly return to The Baileys again and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “lovley hotel”
Reviews.Author: .*.lisa*ma.*.
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the most comfy beds I have slept in a hotel, the room was very clean and has a good shower.The staff were friendly and helpful but i did not rate the breakfast. The location was good within walking distance of the sights and has a goood transport link if your want it.

Reviews.Title: “Ssssh! Keep it a secret!”
Reviews.Author: NYNYGirlie
Reviews.Content: I was meeting some friends in Rome on the spur of the moment and wanted a more initimate hotel than the big chains. I really found a gem! This place was top shelf and the service from all the staff was wonderful! I especially loved the bathrooms with the marble tubs, lovely bath products and fluffy robes. Upon arriving in my room, the management welcomed me with a fruit basket and a bottle of water. The location is perfect for walking through Rome -- near the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. I would highly reccommend this hotel but let's keep it a secret amongst friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GSC2006
Reviews.Content: After staying in Paris, we expected another really small room. This is the European norm, right? Wrong. What a surprise to walk into a large room with 12 to 14 ft. ceilings, gorgeous window coverings, king size bed, and full marble bathroom complete with tub, toilet & bidet! Just beautiful. And a great location. We only had one partial day in Rome (having just completed a European cruise) and had to fly back the next day - but we could easily walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps from the hotel. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation very close to the hotel (since we had walked around the historic center of Rome all day), the front desk clerk called and made reservations for us at a restaurant in the next block where we enjoyed not only a great meal, but felt like family by the time we left - complete with hugs and kisses from the maitre 'd, Domenico, at Ristorante La Pentolaccia - he speaks perfect English, and will even help you with your Italian! The included breakfast the next morning was in a beautiful little breakfast room and was delicious. We would definitely return to Hotel Bailey's-Roma (we each threw a coin in the Trevi Fountain - let's see if it works!)

Reviews.Title: “Bailey's Hotel - safe bet”
Reviews.Author: minimal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Hotel Bailey's for 12 days and had a pleasant experience there. We have both traveled to various countries in Europe and were a little wary of hotels that claim to be "brand new" "quiet" and "well appointed"... sometimes things can seem too good to be true. Upon our arrival to Hotel Bailey's, our worries went away - the staff was helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location on a quiet street away from the touristy areas was a nice way to relax at the end of a full day. The breakfast buffet was standard fare - meats, breads, juice. There were a number of wonderful little restaurants next to the hotel as well (we liked Henry Cow), and a grocery 1/2 block away.. their stuffed tomatoes are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Bailey's was great find”
Reviews.Author: BHGIRL
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed at the Bailey Hotel for 4 nights at the end of August and would have loved to stay longer! A lovely boutique hotel, it is within walking distance of all the sites, but if you want transportation, the Metro, buses, and taxis are easy to obtain. We walked to the Vatican, which is quite far but an enjoyable walk with the many astounding sights along the way. Simona and the other desk staff were always ready to help -- from lining up taxis to recommending restaurants to suggesting a cool hairdresser for my daughter. The buffet was by far the best we had in Italy, with nice quality cheeses, meats, cereals, fruits, baked goods, and of course cappuccinos. The room was beautifully decorated, clean, with all the amenities you could want, including a fruit basket upon our arrival. Via Flavia has several intimate cafes along the route, a nearby pharmacy, and three well-stocked grocery stores open until 8 or 9 for staples and treats. We loved Rome but it is a big city, and Bailey's provided a very relaxing retreat at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_26
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bailey's Hotel after seeing good reviews but these were understatements for the quality of experience we had. The staff are excellent - very informative, friendly and extremely helpful, and the breakfast was a buffet with everything we wanted. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very comfortable. One of our party needed a wheelchair for the weekend, and Simona went to great efforts to organise this for us. We would highly recommend this hotel. Although a short walk from the main areas, it is worth it for the standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful stay at Baileys Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellow2575
Reviews.Content: My mum and I have just returned from our stay at the Baileys Hotel for 4 nights. I picked this hotel after reading all the great reviews and it did live up to expectations. Greeted by helpful staff on arrival, given a map and pointed out the main sites. The twin room was kept spotless during our stay and had a marble bathroom with shower and bath. We requested extra coathangers and they arrived by the time we came back from a look around. Breakfast was served in a lovely area with a large choice of fruit, breads, cereal, ham, cheese, pastries, cappucinno, hot chocolate, which kept us going until early afternoon. The nearest Metro is 'Republica', about 10/12 mins walk from the hotel and the Termini for catching buses is again about 10 mins walk. The hotels location suited us as it was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the immediate centre but it may be a little far out for some. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: karryn
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and won't be our last. Do go for the deluxe room, a little extra but well worth it. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and Simona is particularly helpful. If you want advice on things to do and see or need bookings for taxis etc they are very willing. There are great restaurants within walking distance and we walked from hotel to St Peters without feeling the strain. All the tourist attractions are within very easy walking distance as is the Termini (Train & bus station). I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome wanting an excellent place to stay with fantastic service. Karryn & Simon Cheshire

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at The Bailey's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al001
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel in a quiet street in Rome. Rooms modern and well equipped. Best thing about this hotel are the staff on the front desk Mauro and Christiano specifically - nothing was too much trouble for them from making restaurant reservations to booking tickets for concerts. Can't say enough good things about the service

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Alicadoo
Reviews.Content: From the top then: We arrived into Ciampino airport and I had arranged a transfer with the hotel. The driver was duly waiting on us and we were at the hotel in about 30 mins. I would recommend the transfer as the Termini is a good 10-15 walk from the hotel and the area around Termini isn't the nicest. (Also the cobbles would be a pain if you were dragging luggage). We arrived around mid morning so had to wait an hour or so for our room, this wasn't a problem as there are many cafes and restaurants within a couple of minutes from the hotel. On our return our luggage had been left to our room, without asking. The room was on the top floor with a view of the rooftops of Rome. It was very spacious and spotlessly clean, all the usual facilities but no tea/coffee, not really a problem though. The room was quite traditional in style rather than modern but very much in keeping with the public areas of the hotel. The bathroom again was spotless and finished in marble. (no bath, just shower) The room was quiet and comfortable, exactly what you need after a days sightseeing. Breakfast was served in a basement area which was bright and cheerful although there was no natural light. The breakfast was fairly standard cereal, bread, ham, cheese, fruit and yoghurt, perfectly adequate to start the day. The hotel is located in a quiet residential street just off the Via XX Septembre, all the main tourist sites (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Forum etc) are within walking distance apart from the Vatican which can be reached by bus from the Termini. We got restaurant recommendations from the hotel staff but to be honest the restaurants we found ourselves were probably better. There are about 6 good restaurants within 5 mins of the hotel. In particular one on the same street about 200m if you turn right going out the front door. (Sorry name escapes me but the best tiramisu ever!) The hotel staff were polite and efficient, however if you are used to the fake Holiday Inn style, 'Have a nice Day' then you will be dissappointed, however I found this quite refreshing. The only very minor complaint would be that one day housekeeping didn't make it until 4pm, however they appeared when we went out for dinner at 8 and cleaned then. To sum up I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and indeed would stay here again without question. (Dont forget to try the ice cream!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucicrisp
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Bailey's in Rome with our 18 month old son in May. It's a lovely hotel, the staff are really helpful, and the rooms are great. It's a bit out of the way of the main tourist attractions but as a plus is lovely and quiet in the evenings and mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great friendly professional staff; nothing a trouble; room and breakfast excellent. Location perfect for walking to attractions and quality restaurants nearby. Will stay again on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bailey's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bailey's Hotel is a lovely quiet haven in busy Rome. We found the staff to be welcoming, friendly and very helpful providing advice on restaurants, sightseeing, travel and even checking all our forward travel arrangements for us. The rooms were delightful and spacious for a boutique hotel in Rome, spotlessly clean with large comfortable beds. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. The views weren't great but thats a small price to pay for such a quiet room just a short walk from the spanish steps. There's a great variety of restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel with a range of prices but our favourite had to be the wine bar and bistro on the corner - can't remember its name but served wonderful wine and delicious food Will stay at Baileys again and recommend it to friends visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Evening Concierge -Great Advice on Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Bailey's Hotel, but the advice given to us on where to eat at local restaurants was outstanding. Many Thanks to Simona for her great recommendations. The room was very comfortable and large and the mini balcony was an added feature. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the peace and quiet at night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quiet non intrusive very efficient, helpful and professional staff. Room just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Awful noises and no views”
Reviews.Author: merphile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Bailey's Hotel a few days ago. At first we had a reservation in the Gambrinus, but they sent us to the Bailey's apparently because there was a problem with the hot water. They said that the Bailey's was same owner and similar category. The hotel was clean and well furnished. Nevertheless, we were highly disappointed when we saw that the room had just a small window over a corridor and was just facing a wall less than half-a-meter far. We asked for another room but the hotel was full. Later, walking around the corridors, we saw that most of the rooms had just small windows with no views whatsoever. We could not even open the window at night to get some fresh air, as anyone could have accessed it from the small corridor. But the worse was to come. The room was on the sixth floor just besides the area with all the machines for the hotel (I guess, water, heating, air conditining, etc.). When we arrived at the hotel at night, the noise was UNBEARABLE. We could even feel the vibrations of the machines through the wall. We were really getting sick of it, and it was totally impossible to sleep. We called the reception asking for a change and they said they would try to do something. After two attemps, the noise became less loud. It was anoying (like an air-conditioning machine) but at least we could sleep. The night after, same story: we had to call twice to the reception to get it a bit down. I guess the room in front and the rooms underneath are equally disturbed by the noise. We paid 360 euros for two nights. For that price, I think that at least one has the right to have a rest. It really ruined our stay in Rome. The employees were not helpful at all. If you want to be able to sleep and to get some fresh air in the room, don't go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Fan of The Bailey's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and clean hotel in a good location. The staff is exceptionally courteous, effecient, knowlegdeable and helpful. All excursions and experiences arranged outside of the hotel (by staff) were also done with great satisfaction. I will definately use them again when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beauitful hotel. Our room was exactly as the pictures looked. Everything was first class, including the service. The breakfast was delicious. Truly a masterful place. Absolutely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lainee_L
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 3) stayed for 4 nights. The staff were friendly and very helpful; organised a taxi to the airport, advised about tours around Rome. The room decor is a bit kitsch but the rooms are very comfortable. It's a small hotel but it's in a very good area - one metro stop from Termini and there are quite a few good shops and restaurants nearby. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this superb small hotel. The location, the staff (especially the ever-helpful Simona Messina), and the rooms are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “terrific!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, perfect location,all the staff were nice and welcoming,loads of choice for breakfast (the best cappuccino I ever had!). I had visited a lot of hotels in Rome, but The Bailey's hotel it's absolutely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoxsmumMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bailey for 3 nights in October 2005. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the main railway station and about a 15 minute walk to the Trevi fountain. Take a tip from us though and don't walk to the hotel with big suitcases in pouring rain - not the best way to arrive at this classy little hotel. The hotel is in a good area with lots of quaint little restaurants for a low key dinner. It is a fairly quick walk into town and all the sights. Just make sure you do know where you are going as the streets of Rome can be a little confusing. The room was a good size, tastefully decorated and recently renovated. Very quiet. The bathrrom was lovely and also fairly new. We paid about $345 AUS per night which was not cheap, but there is a great included breakfast and the staff are very helpful and all speak English. Would not hesitate to stay here again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Bailey!”
Reviews.Author: DirtyBird
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bailey is a wonderful hotel in Rome. We were there with a group of friends from through the US and we stayed there for 5 nights. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, especially Simona. The room was very comfortable with a wonderful bed. There are lots of terrific eateries within a 3-5 block radius. Ask the Hotel staff for recommendations. We did seem to get some smoke coming in periodically either from the courtyard area or through the ventillation system. Overall, though, would definitely stay there next time I'm in Rome and would recommend that my friends stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS time we all LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there and had a great time, it is in such a marvellous part of the city - close to everything, but so quiet. The staff are friendly, helpful, courteous and efficient. We would visit there any time. They were lovely to our children who wanted to stay there forever. The food is delicious - with a lovely breakfast menu and wonderful staff in the restaurant. Perfect way to start a day to explore Rome. Couldn't recommend it more!

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Baileys Hotel is a quaint, modernised, comfortable and clean establishment in a quiet location about 20 minutes by foot from Termini station. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, offering very useful information to visitors such as the best transport options around the city. A nice touch is a complimentary bowl of fresh fruit in your room on arrival. For an overview of the city, we recommend the Red “110 open” bus with stops at all of Rome’s popular sights (good value at 13 Euros for a “hop off – hop on” all day ticket including an evening service to view the illuminated city by night). Most of the sights are within walking distance of the hotel (except perhaps the Vatican, which is reachable on the 62 or 64 (?) bus from a stop on nearby Via XX September). The hotel’s inclusive continental breakfast was a welcome start to each day. For evening meals, there is a good choice of family run restaurants in the immediate district (on or just off Via Flavia) offering excellent traditional menus. Two particularly recommended restaurants are “La Lampada” and “Henry Cow” (just along from the hotel). Due to its location, The Bailey’s Hotel offers a good quiet nights sleep and in very comfortable beds. The bathrooms are in traditional marble style with powerful showers! The one slightly negative point is the absence of coffee / tea making facilities in the rooms (although this appears to be standard in mainland Europe). On the whole a very pleasant and comfortable hotel, ideal for a short break in a vibrant city!

Reviews.Title: “viva Hotel Bailey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I very recently spent a week in Rome and had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Bailey. I found the hotel to be a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are very neat and clean. The beds are made with crisp, clean linens. The bed was the most comfortable of any hotel I have ever been in. The staff are the friendliest and most courteous of any I have ever met. The Continental breakfasts are superb. The hotel is located close enough to sightseeing that you can walk and very good restaurants are within walking distance, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff & Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Bailey's Hotel. It began with a cheerful and helpful staff, especially Simona. There were three of us to a room, one Double and one Single bed and still enough room for 6 extra large suitcases. All of our luggage was taken to our room immediately upon arrival. The room was exquisite, the fruit basket was fabulous and refreshing. The Bathroom had all the amenities. The complimentary breakfasts were outstanding. The assortment of fresh fruits, pies, breads, meats, etc. were fantastic. Everything you could think of and more. The staff was pleasant and extremely helpful and I might add although we spoke Italian there English was great. They had all the answers to our questions. They had maps available, information on local shops, etc. They took care of our taxi and airport reservations. They informed us of the rates so that we would not overpay. I could go on and on. Quite a fantastic experience. We spent 30 days in Italy and 4 of the best days were at the Bailey's Hotel. I might add that our room rate was very reasonable at $170.00 per night (3 Persons). Thank you! I hope to return soon. Sandra Pentecost

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: seb08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel 27/12 to 31/12.After getting soaked walking from the Termini (20 minutes but do find the correct exit)we were delighted to find the hotel welcoming and warm.The triple room we occupied was beautifully decorated,the beds comfy,bathroom clean with a very good shower.The housekeeping very efficient and the turn down service a great touch. Breakfast- a good variety although some dishes unusual, more than enough to satisfy. Excellent reception staff recommended the Ristorante La Pentolaccia across the Via Flavia. We went there every night, food good, service and atmosphere excellent,booking advisable. If visiting Vatican and Colosseum we would advise to get there very early and try to use the services of the English speaking guides who are able to get you in quickly.Good detailed street map of Rome needed, be aware eating out is pricy especially near the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A really top class hotel close enough to all the sites in the centre of Rome (take your walking shoes though!) but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of tourist packed streets. The room was amply spacious, beautifully decorated and absolutely immaculate. Watch out for the pricey snacks in the mini bar though! Breakfast was outstanding and the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little further away from Termini station than they let on on the Baileys hotel website, but that's probably because it can take you 10 minutes to find your way out of the station onto the correct street exit! To be honest, it's a good 20 minute walk from the time you set foot off the train to the hotel (travelling with luggage and if you know where you're going!). Be very careful of the taxi drivers outside the station - some of them are real pirates and wanted to charge us 40 euros for a five minute journey (which should ordinarily cost 5-10 euros maximum). Fortunately we were well informed about the hotel location so knew they were trying to rip us off. However, your stay at the Baileys Hotel will more than make up for those minor hiccups that are inevitable when travelling to a foreign country, particularly in a city where very little English is spoken!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mimitraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gemstone in Italy. Beautiful decor, beautiful rooms, excellent service and scrumptious breakfast. Location wise its not right in the heart of Rome but we enjoyed the 15 minute walk into the heart of it to walk off all the yummy Italian food we overindulged in! Can't really fault anything about this hotel. They really pay attention to detail with umbrellas at the door, fruit on arrival and really clean rooms. Definetely would stay there again.
